intro: Molinia ujhelyii, commonly known as the Hungarian moor grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils, often found in wet meadows and bogs. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Molinia ujhelyii plays an important ecological role in maintaining the structure and biodiversity of its habitat.
